info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:03PM CDT until April 17 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following county, Poinsett.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed across the county due to significant river flooding along and near the St. Francis and Cache Rivers.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trumann, Marked Tree, Harrisburg, Lepanto, Tyronza, Weiner, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Fisher, Whitaker, Landers, Weona, McCormick, Weona Junction, Promised Land, Old Weona, Stewart, Bay Village, Maple Grove and Wiley Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THURSDAY
